title: Randomized, Double-Blinded, Placebo-Controlled, Open Label Positive- Controlled, Four-Way Crossover Study of the Electrocardiographic Effects of BMS-708163 in Healthy Subjects
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of BMS-708163 on the QTc interval (QT interval corrected for heart rate).
explanation_target: Reason: The described trial tests BMS-708163's effect on QTc in healthy subjects. BMS-708163 is avagacestat, an orally bioavailable γ‑secretase inhibitor developed to lower Aβ (Alzheimer's disease pathology), so its intended action is disease-targeted (anti-amyloid) rather than a symptomatic cognitive enhancer or neuropsychiatric agent. citeturn2search1turn0search1

Act: Key extracted details — trial NCT00979316 (randomized, double-blind, placebo- and positive-controlled, 4‑period crossover) evaluated single doses of BMS-708163 (e.g., 200 mg and 800 mg reported in the registry entry), placebo, and moxifloxacin as positive control to assess QTc effects. The drug BMS-708163 (avagacestat) has been shown in clinical studies to reduce CSF Aβ species, consistent with γ‑secretase inhibition. citeturn2search1turn0search0

Reflect: Classification check — avagacestat is a small-molecule γ‑secretase inhibitor developed to modify amyloid processing (disease-modifying approach). Therefore the correct category is 'disease-targeted small molecule'. This trial is a cardiac-safety (QTc) study, not an efficacy trial; that does not change the drug's mechanistic category. Relevant discovery and clinical development references are listed below. citeturn0search3turn2search7

Web search results (selected): 1) PubMed phase‑1/PK/PD study describing avagacestat effects on CSF Aβ after single doses. citeturn0search0 2) PubMed multicenter single-ascending dose study and tolerability/pharmacodynamic profile of BMS‑708163 (avagacestat). citeturn0search1 3) ACS Medicinal Chemistry Letters paper on discovery and properties of BMS‑708163 (potent, selective, orally bioavailable γ‑secretase inhibitor). citeturn0search3 4) Clinical trial registry entry for NCT00979316 (QTc study of BMS‑708163 vs placebo and moxifloxacin). citeturn2search1 5) Phase‑2 safety/tolerability results and dose-finding context for BMS‑708163 in mild‑to‑moderate AD. citeturn2search7
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational agent is BMS-708163 (avagacestat), an orally bioavailable γ‑secretase inhibitor whose intended mechanism is to lower production of amyloid‑β (Aβ) species by modulating APP processing—i.e., a disease‑modifying anti‑amyloid approach. This directly maps to the CADRO amyloid category.

Act: Key extracted details from the trial description — drug: BMS‑708163 (avagacestat), a small‑molecule γ‑secretase inhibitor; trial: randomized, double‑blind, placebo‑ and positive‑controlled 4‑way crossover (QTc/safety study, NCT00979316 reported in registries); pharmacodynamic findings in clinical studies show reductions in CSF Aβ consistent with γ‑secretase inhibition. Because the mechanism is explicitly to alter Aβ production/processing, assign 'A) Amyloid beta'.

Reflect: The assignment to A) Amyloid beta is consistent with CADRO definitions: γ‑secretase inhibition targets the amyloid pathway (production of Aβ). Although the specific trial is a cardiac‑safety (QTc) study rather than an efficacy trial, that does not change the drug’s mechanistic classification. There is no indication of additional, distinct primary targets that would require 'R) Multi‑target' or lack of a therapeutic target that would require 'T) Other'.

Web search results (selected, summarized): 1) Phase‑1 PK/PD publications reporting avagacestat effects on CSF Aβ after single doses (PubMed). 2) Multicenter single‑ascending dose/tolerability studies of BMS‑708163 (avagacestat) describing pharmacodynamics and safety (PubMed). 3) Medicinal chemistry report describing discovery and properties of BMS‑708163 as a potent, orally available γ‑secretase inhibitor (ACS Medicinal Chemistry Letters). 4) ClinicalTrials.gov registry entry for NCT00979316 — QTc study of BMS‑708163 vs placebo and moxifloxacin. 5) Phase‑2 safety/tolerability and dose‑finding reports for avagacestat in mild‑to‑moderate AD. These sources consistently describe avagacestat as a γ‑secretase (anti‑amyloid) small molecule, supporting the CADRO classification.
Conclusion (Output): A) Amyloid beta — BMS‑708163 (avagacestat) is a γ‑secretase inhibitor targeting amyloid‑β production; therefore the trial/drug maps to CADRO category A.
